Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my life!!”
Reviews.Author: Niels G
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have experienced such poor service, quality of rooms or cleanliness. This hotel ought to be condemned. There was mold everywhere, the staff didn't know which rooms were available and which wasn't (eventhough I had ordered in advance) or how to check in or out. This review doesn't even begin to explain how terrible the experience was, and I genuinly hope that noone ever visits this "hotel" again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Jacob M
Reviews.Content: The Golders Green Hotel was good intimate. True the room was compact but provided all that a person needs. Staff were excellent, Breakfast was good, Room clean, and very good value for money. Although I was facing the main road I slept like a log. Would recomend it any day. Jacob Menashy

Reviews.Title: “Warning Please DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Millie187069
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this "Hotel". We made a late booking and basically this was the only place available close to family we were visiting. Yes it was basic but I thought what do you expect and the bed sheets etc looked presentable. It was noisy most nights BUT on the last night around 11.30, the room next door erupted with the noise of four young men who sounded high on something, the language and shouting were way past tolerable, they had brought a woman to the room for obvious purposes.. At this point (12.15) my husband went down to the front desk, the night porter told him that 2 had checked in and the others were guests, he seemed genuinely frightened of this gang and we advised to call the Police. He did call to the room and tell them to leave. At 1.15am my husband saw 4 young men leaving the room, one had a scarf covering his face, another had his hat pulled down, one was over 6foot and obviously not the type you would confront. I heard them saying they were going to use the side door to get back in, I was genuinely terrified, to the extent I barricaded our door with the heavy suitcases, believe me I sensed the potential to go very wrong. The next morning the Manager shrugged his shoulders and said "This is bad luck, no money back but 1 nights stay free another time" ha as if ever.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe their Home Page”
Reviews.Author: ednabook
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 nights while working at Brent Cross Shopping Centre. I have to be honest and admit that after driving from Nottingham, working all day then going straight from work for a meal & refreshments, when i checked in and went to my room all i wanted was to sleep so didn't pay much attention to the room. It wasn't until the following morning that it became apparent how poor the room was. The bathroom was tiny 8' x 3' (approx & i think i am being generous here) One needed to be a contortionist to use the toilet, reversing in in a squatting position to land correctly avoiding the sink. The shower sprayed the bathroom while leaving the body below dry while the shower curtain clung to ones back like batmans cape. No plug in the sink. No curtain at the bathroom window. The sleeping area was, like the bathroom, only fit for a 5' contortionist. To get into bed one had to stoop to avoid the sloping pitched roof and lying down was the only way to watch the 14" antique portable tv, the like of which can normally only be seen in skips, which was on the 24" high table at the foot of the bed thus requiring the viewer to lay prostate with 2 pillows behind ones head and feet like the hands of a clock at 14.50 to see the screen, no remote control (probably not invented when this tv was made) If one preffered black tea or coffee then you would be happy, i like milk in my coffee so couldn't have a drink as there was none. The bed was comfy, i slept like a log the first night though this was probably more to do with exhaustion and alcohol, i also slept well the second night with less alcohol in my blood so i can say the bed was ok. I would have complained but as i was only there 2 nights simply couldnt be bothered also it was Wimbledon fortnight and everywhere was v busy and priced accordingly. The smoke alarm was broken it was just the base unit with wires hanging from it so i assume this was a smoking allowed room !

Reviews.Title: “The worst place I've have ever been!!!”
Reviews.Author: GiovanaH
Reviews.Content: The worts Hotel I have ever been. The buiding smells trash all the time and it gets worse in your room. There is no decent breakfast ( coffee it looks like very very old), and to have a better idea, the "food" is prepared in the same room where the cleaner keep the cleaning utensils.While she prepares your "breakfast" she will be dealinh with trash bags and dirty things from each room. Staff not friendly at all and will keep an eye on you as we were not welcome in the buiding. Rooms are unsafe and parking is only available when they let you. Construction people would park their van in front of the building. You might have to park on the streets and have to pay per hour. It's not worth staying in this place, considering you can send some extra pounds to eat and sleep in a clean and safe place. This is not a decent hotel. P.S. I had the opportunity to observe while the cleaner was cleaning my room and the sheets were not replaced, bathroom not touched!!!!! Warning: Do not book in this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “close this place down...it defies the "Trade Descriptions Act"”
Reviews.Author: mbwlighting
Reviews.Content: Dirty, smelly, unhygenic, broken, unsafe....the worst place I have had the misfortune to stay in. Do not stay at this hotel(?). The list of things that are wrong would go on and on and on...its only redeeming feature is its location, and proximity to Hamstead Heath. It would be better to book into Travel Lodge or Premier Inn style Hotel....possibly a little more expensive but you would at least feel that you had value for money and peace of mind. Suggest anyone who has stayed here contacts the Trading Standards Officer at Barnet council, also the Public Health Officer at the same Council

Reviews.Title: “Simply the worst hotel we have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: kiwichick14
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the 2nd of may 2009. We wanted something close to all amenities. When we arrived and were taken to our room I thought oh my god what have we done. The bed was a camp bed, the duvet was not that clean, there was no tv remote and the bathroom was filthy. The room stank of damp and the view from our room looked like an EARTHQUAKE had just happened. If it had not been for the fact that we were meeting our daughter in central London and were already late and also it was a bank holiday ,so of course every hotel was booked, we would have left straight away. It was simply the most discusting place we have ever been. We will be reporting this hotel to the hotel complaints department. Ps the breakfast we did not touch!!! A tip DO NOT EVER GO TO THIS HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: visioner1111
Reviews.Content: We checked into room 208, which like the rest of the hotel, needs an immediate renovation. My wife woke up at 3am with multiple bites on her arm and face. Checking the bed we discovered bed bugs on the sheets. The hotel replaced our room, but no apologies were made. My wife went with a swollen face to an interview the morning after. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone- for an additional 30-40 pounds you can book a 4 star hotel in a better location.

Reviews.Title: “[--] all around”
Reviews.Author: Rogerer
Reviews.Content: Not a good night sleep with paper-thick wall!! You can count how many couples are doing their night-job at the same time. If you finally got into sleep, the door-banging upstairs must scared you up from dreams..... Worse, they cheated by talking differently of their refund procedure. Somebody turns up claiming to be a Manager said you've informed by 24hrs to get refund; while other staff just casually said, "You can find the manager in morning and get your money." So, do pay few pounds more and go to Solomon/Regal, NOT HERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: CrackerMackey
Reviews.Content: This is quite simply the worst excuse for a hotel I've ever had the pleasure of staying in. The bedroom was extremely dirty, both beds were campbeds, and several floorboards were loose and in some cases missing. There was exposed electrical wires dangling from walls and the bathroom lighting was not working. Staff were unfriendly and unhelpful and seemed to have an unnealthly obsession about the whereabouts of our belongings. I didn't feel safe here. On the plus side, its cheap and its located near bus and tube.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pinktimtams
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night only at that was enough! I was looking for a room for a few nites until i moved into my new house. This place was convenient and available so i took it. BIG mistake! The single room i had was tiny and absolutely stank of stale smoke! The flurosecent green light from the sign outside did not provide any further ambience! No help was given when asked with my luggage in fact i was told to do it myself as it was too big! Once in the room that stank so bad all my clothes now smell the tv failed to work. When i went to reception i was told that they couldn't help me until management arrived the next morning. When i did complain the next day i was told that i had been offered another room with a tv that worked but declined as it was on the second level due to my big luggage. When i responded that all rooms should have working tv's regardless of floor level i was met with silence. DON't stay at this hotel.. how it can be classified a hotel i am yet to understand! If you are looking for somewhere to stay try the Martel guest house where i went for the next 2 nite's. Clean, convenient and pleasant people to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Burglarized and uncooperative”
Reviews.Author: lisabethie
Reviews.Content: I went with a group and on the first night of our stay (Fri. night) one room was burglarized. There was no break in, but magically the people in the room lost their money, credit cards and digital cameras. The front desk man was threatning and volatile over the situation and it was very suspicious. The hotel is running on it's last leg and there is no security. Many rooms are on the first floor and there is access from a back door. Please do not stay here....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: northeastScotland
Reviews.Content: On the website for this hotel, it indicated that this hotel was newly redecorated which is why I reserved it. On arrival, albeit some hours before the normal access to room time, I was given an available room for Â£45 per night, Â£4 less than the website price. I would say that the hotel is still undergoing redecoration as there were pots of paint lying around and if it isn't, it should be. My room had some hardboard up against the wall which was cut away at the top displaying part of a bare wall and what looked like the beginning of a hole. The room was very small, which I didn't find a problem as I used it only for sleeping in but it wasn't very cheerful and was dusty. but it faced the road and I had the window opened all the time. The curtains could have done with a wash. I wasn't impressed by the buffet breakfast, so only had the coffee which I don't think was of very good quality. I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and helpful place”
Reviews.Author: roro20
Reviews.Content: Found this B&B through a friends recomendation, and was pleased with my stay. The Price was great as was i london on a budget . I asked for a quiet room so was given a nicely sized room on the back of the hotel so was vey peaceful. The staff are great and really enjoyed breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “great place!!”
Reviews.Author: j50-7
Reviews.Content: stayed at golders green hotel in august 2006 for 3 nights and my wife and I really enjoyed our stay. We found the hotel very clean, spacious rooms and great value for money. The staff were great with us and very helpful with information and the location is fantastic, loads of places to eat around and close to underground would def come again!

Reviews.Title: “Got what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went with a group which was fantastic. We found the hotel more like a youth hostel, but I Suppose you get what you pay for. If you are looking for a Hilton you have come to the wrong place, but if you need a cheap and cheerful hotel this is it. It may not be in the best condition but you can' have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: collectorsworld
Reviews.Content: We called and asked for 1 double room for 2 nights a week before. We called twice to make sure all was ok as the night receptionist did not speak adequate English, we called again the next day and our double room was confirmed. We arrived at the hotel They could not find the key to the room and we had to wait for an hour until the young girl found it. Then we found that we had been given a twin bedded room instead of a double room. This room was rather dingy and not very clean. It seemed otherwise adequate for the reduced price due to their error and we agreed to remain for the 2 nights. However, we then discovered that there were baby cockroaches in the bathroom and in our bed. We showed the night manager who did not apologise or offer another room or ...... he treated us as though we were a nuisance. Then we noticed the wires loose in the bathroom and one bedside light was broken and they couldn't fix it. We of course mentioned this to the receptionist who again treated us as though we were complaining about nothing. The television in the room did not work on a regular basis, it had a booster which did not work. We stayed the second night thinking that things could'nt get worse but... we were wrong. The second night was a complete disaster! we were woken up at about 2 am by a lunatic in the room next door who threw out his heater into the corridor thus blocking the passage (we have a witness for this event) and then started walking up and down his room and slamming doors in his room, and what sounded like hitting the wall between our rooms. We again called the night receptionist who came up and listened but of course, the person pretended to be asleep so that the receptionis treated us as though we were crazy, this carried on until 4.30 am. By this time we were totally demented, shocked by the treatment meted out to us by the receptionist. In the morning we realised that apart from all that my wife had been eaten alive by fleas! We packed and got ready to leave the hotel but stopped at the reception to hand in the key. We were accosted by the lunatic from the room next door complaining that we had kept him awake! The day Receptionist (who has allegedly worked there for 15 years) told us to leave the hotel as we were a nuisance! She backed this lunatic and told us that we had not stopped complaining since we arrived. Well, we certainly had reasons for that and we most definitely are complaining of having been subjected to a weekend of hell by the atrocious conduct of the hotel staff (owners?) Oh, and there are NO double rooms in this hotel! We are taking counsel on this whole sorry event.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room but Adequate”
Reviews.Author: JGMotek
Reviews.Content: I got about what I expected for 30 pounds a night in London: a very, very small room (had a choice in my single room between being able to open my suitcase or being able to use the closet) and somewhat dingy surroundings. The TV in the room is tiny and gets about 2 stations. However, the staff were friendly and the breakfast was adequate. Many kosher restaurants are nearby and the Tube station, about a 10-minute walk, is about a 20-minute trip to the city. Although the web site says that meals for the Sabbath can be arranged, this basically means having to call a local deli and ask for food to be delivered (or going and getting it yourself and keeping it in the fridge) and putting it on a warming tray. You have to buy your own silverware and tablecloth for meat meals as they only have supplies for dairy because of breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: Golders Green Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 147-151 Golders Green Road, London NW11 9BN, England
